item.title: Rate Limiting in a Distributed System
item.description: Assume that we own a suite of API based microservices that implement a discount coupon service. Rate-limiting is needed to ensure that all clients have equal access to our resources and protect our APIs from (malicious or erroneous) intensive usage. Rate-limiting seems straightforward: we only allow a given client to perform X calls every minute. Itâ€™s quite easy to implement on a single server instance, and we can easily find libraries to do that for us.
